content: Luca Bianchi is a software engineer who works at TechCorp in Milan, Italy. He specializes in artificial intelligence and machine learning.
TechCorp is a technology company founded in 2015. The company has offices in Milan, Rome, and Berlin, and employs over 500 people.
The Memento MCP project is an open-source knowledge graph system designed for AI agents. It was created to provide persistent memory capabilities.
Neo4j is a graph database that Memento MCP uses for storing entities and relationships. It supports vector embeddings for semantic search.
Milan is the second-largest city in Italy and a major financial center. It is known for fashion, design, and technology industries.
Luca Bianchi graduated from Politecnico di Milano with a Master's degree in Computer Science in 2018. His thesis focused on neural networks.
The Model Context Protocol (MCP) is a standard for connecting AI models with external tools and data sources. It enables seamless integration.
TechCorp's main product is CloudFlow, a cloud-based workflow automation platform used by enterprise clients worldwide.
OpenAI provides embedding models like text-embedding-3-small that convert text into vector representations for semantic similarity.
Luca Bianchi leads a team of 5 engineers at TechCorp. The team is working on integrating AI capabilities into CloudFlow.
